SENT.plain: 1q21 is frequently involved in different types of translocation in many types of cancers
Jumping translocation (JT) is an unbalanced translocation that comprises amplified chromosomal segments jumping to various telomeres
In this study, we identified a novel gene human JTB (Jumping Translocation Breakpoint) at 1q21, which fused with the telomeric repeats of acceptor telomeres in a case of JT
hJTB (human JTB) encodes a trans-membrane protein that is highly conserved among divergent eukaryotic species
JT results in a hJTB truncation, which potentially produces an hJTB product devoid of the trans-membrane domain
hJTB is located in a gene-rich region at 1q21, called EDC (Epidermal Differentiation Complex)
This is the first report identifying the gene involved in unbalanced translocations at 1q21
